description.narrative: Health COVID-19 Response, which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care (Covid), Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved access and increased utilization of quality and equity focused Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) and immunization services for mothers, new born, U5 children and adolescent girls in most deprived provinces and areas

participating-org.narrative: DOPH TAKHAR DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: Afghanistan like other countries was severely affected by COVID 19 pandemic. During 2021 around104,916 confirmed COVID 19 cases and over 5,106 deathswere reported in the country. UNICEF supported national COVID 19 response mainly through procurement of critical and essential supplies, installation of oxygen plants and IPC materials which helped COVID 19 centers continue case management and protecting health workers through Personal Protection Equipment (PPE) provision. access to critical case management services with essential medicines and supply items, and Risk Communications & Community Engagement (RCCE) activities helped communities control COVID 19 further spread by rising awareness of IPC measures | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022
